bug.short_desc: Add symbolic icon from unstable release

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Please, add symbolic icon for liferea from unstable release (part of 1.11.xx version): https://github.com/lwindolf/liferea/blob/master/pixmaps/scalable/liferea-symbolic.svg It's the default in 1.11 and provides visual consistency in GNOME Shell.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
liferea-1.10.16-1.fc22
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase

Is anyone else seeing liferea's symbolic icon in Gnome's dash since installing this update ?

I am on rawhide liferea-1.10.18-4.fc25.x86_64 and while the icon on the apps screen list is the usual liferea icon, the icon on the dash is the symbolic one. Starting a drag-and-drop on the apps icon is also using the symbolic.
liferea-1.10.18-4.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-aabd68306c
liferea-1.10.18-5.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-3912a330b3
liferea-1.10.18-4.fc22 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 22. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1535722f49

(In reply to Yanko Kaneti from comment #17) > > the icon on the dash is the symbolic one.
Armed with the knowledge that I'm not the only person to whom this is happening, I took a better look at the spec file and realized that the symbolic icon must not only be located in /usr/share/icons/hicolor/symbolic/apps/, it must be called $PROGRAM-symbolic.svg .
I've released yet another update that hopefully will be the last one in this bug.
